title: Memory leak in perf tests (CI only)
body:
<!--NOTE: -->
<!--- General questions should go to the discord chat instead of the issue tracker.-->

**Describe the bug**

I've been playing around with the benchmarks on https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/pull/2665 because it seems that there is a serious memory leak causing an OOM if perf tests run for too long. I have not been able to reproduce this locally tho.

@tuyennhv I have a separate branch https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/tree/benchmark that logs memory usage and triggers garbage collection manually and when run it CI it clearly shows that there is a leak preventing > 1GB of memory from being garbage collected.

The initial resident set (rss) is `rss: 2453975040`. However here you can see that after manually triggering GC it fails to clean up extra memory.
```

2021-06-10T14:56:00.2479703Z @chainsafe/lodestar-beacon-state-transition:   external: 141899282,

2021-06-10T14:56:14.5052136Z @chainsafe/lodestar-beacon-state-transition:   rss: 3653804032,
2021-06-10T14:56:14.5053846Z @chainsafe/lodestar-beacon-state-transition:   heapTotal: 3199950848,
2021-06-10T14:56:14.5055508Z @chainsafe/lodestar-beacon-state-transition:   heapUsed: 3133330992,
```

The logs above are from the benchmarks job in the `benchmark` branch.
It's not a memory leak, but our states take 1.5GB of memory, so two independent states already reach the default 2.5GB limit
